title: OECD Macroeconomic Data
description:
Description
Cross-section data on OECD countries, used for growth regressions.
reference:
Appendix 1 Nonneman and Vanhoudt (1996), except for one bad misprint:
The value of school for Norway is given as 0.01, the correct value is 0.1
(see Mankiw, Romer and Weil, 1992). OECDGrowth contains the corrected data.

parameters.gdp60:
real GDP in 1960 (per person of working age, i.e., age 15 to 65),
in 1985 international prices.
parameters.school: percentage of the working-age population that is in secondary school.
parameters.popgrowth: annual population growth 1960–1985, computed as log(pop85/pop60)/25.
parameters.gdp85:
real GDP in 1985 (per person of working age, i.e., age 15 to 65),
in 1985 international prices.
parameters.randd:
average of annual ratios of gross domestic expenditure on research 
and development to nominal GDP (of available observations during 1960–1985).
parameters.invest: average of annual ratios of real domestic investment to real GDP (1960–1985).

format: A data frame with 22 observations on the following 6 variables.
